item.description:
Hi, come out and learn how to build a solar hot water heater. We will be meeting int the parking lot of the Governors Inn.

The Green Gorilla's will teach you how to build one, we will then transport it to a house and mount it on the roof and connected to the oil water heater and test it out.

The solar hot water heater will produce about 20 gallons of water at 120 degrees in half an hour and 140 degrees in one hour.

I'm estimating the whole process will take about three hours to build.

There is no cost for this event. The Green Guerillia Institute will be providing all the materials for this event.

If it is raining out we will meet indoors in the ballroom.

We will be joined by other meetup groups, so prepare to meet others who share a passion for saving money and being more sustainable!

We will go for lunch after the event and discuss our project.

If anyone has any questions don't hesitate to contact me at: 603-509-2907

The Governors Inn website is: www.governorsinn.com

See you there.

Peter
item.name: Solar Hot Water Workshop: Build your own solar hot water heater
